fr.sorbonne_u.components.hem2024e1.equipments.heater

Interface HeaterUserCI

  • All Superinterfaces:
    fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.ComponentInterface, HeaterExternalControlI, HeaterTemperatureI, HeaterUserI, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.OfferedCI, java.rmi.Remote, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.RequiredCI
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    HeaterUserConnector, HeaterUserInboundPort, HeaterUserOutboundPort

    public interface HeaterUserCI
extends fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.OfferedCI, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.RequiredCI, HeaterUserI
    The component interface HeaterUserCI declares the signature of the services offered and that can be required by the user from the heater.

    Description

    Black-box Invariants

     invariant       true        // no more invariant

    Created on : 2023-09-18

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double getCurrentPowerLevel()
      return the current power level of the heater.
      double getCurrentTemperature()
      return the current temperature measured by the thermostat.
      double getMaxPowerLevel()
      return the maximum power of the heater in watts.
      double getTargetTemperature()
      get the current target temperature.
      boolean on()
      return true if the heater is currently running.
      void setCurrentPowerLevel(double powerLevel)
      set the power level of the heater; if powerLevel > getMaxPowerLevel() then set the power level to the maximum.
      void setTargetTemperature(double target)
      set the target temperature.
      void switchOff()
      switch off the heater.
      void switchOn()
      switch on the heater.
